name: df-eqg
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cqg, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, copab(s2, s3, wa(wss(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ ~QG =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s2, s3 > |({ s2, s3 } ‚äÜ(Base ` s0)‚àß(((invg ` s0)` s2)[(+ ` s0)]s3)‚àà s1)})
comment: Define the equivalence relation in a group generated by a subgroup. More precisely, if ` G ` is a group and ` H ` is a subgroup, then ` G ~QG H ` is the equivalence relation on ` G ` associated with the left cosets of ` H ` . A typical application of this definition is the construction of the quotient group (resp. ring) of a group (resp. ring) by a normal subgroup (resp. two-sided ideal). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
